description: Based on my problems using ``setup.py install`` to install yt and based on a comment by @ngoldbaum  comment that there is an outstanding issue for better documentation on this issue, I provide this small addition to the documentation.
title: [Closes #1169] Added documentation about setuptools problem

content.raw: The error will be a bit more informative once [pull request 2123](https://bitbucket.org/yt_analysis/yt/pull-requests/2123) is merged.
content.html: The error will be a bit more informative once pull request 2123 is merged.

content.raw: it should also mention old distribute, see PR 2123.
content.html: it should also mention old distribute, see PR 2123.

content.raw: Can you add "closes #1169" to the title of this pull request?
content.html: Can you add "closes #1169" to the title of this pull request?

content.raw: Done. :)
content.html: Done. :)

content.raw:
Is the error message for distribute different? I don't really want to break my installation to find out.

**EDIT:** Nevermind I found it from the issue.
content.html:
Is the error message for distribute different? I don't really want to break my installation to find out.

EDIT: Nevermind I found it from the issue.

content.raw:
Once PR 2123 is merged, it will be something like:

```
        Distribute is a legacy package obsoleted by setuptools.
        We strongly recommend that you just uninstall it.
        If for some reason you cannot do it, you'll need to upgrade it
        to latest version before proceeding:
            pip install -U distribute
```
content.html:
Once PR 2123 is merged, it will be something like:

        Distribute is a legacy package obsoleted by setuptools.
        We strongly recommend that you just uninstall it.
        If for some reason you cannot do it, you'll need to upgrade it
        to latest version before proceeding:
            pip install -U distribute

content.raw: Even then, it's probably a good idea to keep documentation of the error message, in case somebody is using an old version?
content.html: Even then, it's probably a good idea to keep documentation of the error message, in case somebody is using an old version?

content.raw: They won't get to this error message, because our setup.py will exit before it tries to compile anything.
content.html: They won't get to this error message, because our setup.py will exit before it tries to compile anything.

content.raw: I see what you mean, though I don't see a good solution to the problem. Perhaps move the note further down so that it ends above a section heading?
content.html: I see what you mean, though I don't see a good solution to the problem. Perhaps move the note further down so that it ends above a section heading?

content.raw: Yeah, I'm not really sure what the solution to this problem is either.  We could put this note in the FAQ section, but my fear is that not many people look at the faqs.  I know we were planning to have a minor rewrite of the install docs, so maybe it could be structured in such a way to account for this information?  I'm not sure.  Anyone else have ideas?
content.html: Yeah, I'm not really sure what the solution to this problem is either. We could put this note in the FAQ section, but my fear is that not many people look at the faqs. I know we were planning to have a minor rewrite of the install docs, so maybe it could be structured in such a way to account for this information? I'm not sure. Anyone else have ideas?

content.raw: I think @ngoldbaum was planning to do the rewrite of the install docs. He might have some insight.
content.html: I think Nathan Goldbaum was planning to do the rewrite of the install docs. He might have some insight.
